results.title: Oral Antidiabetics and Sleep Among Type 2 Diabetes Patients: Data From the UK Biobank
results.text_hl: As shown by logistic regression adjusted for, e.g., age, @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2D@@@ duration, and HbA1c, @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ on non-@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy (N=815; 86% were treated with @CHEMICAL_Sulfonylurea_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013453 @@@sulphonylureas@@@) had a 1.24-fold higher odds ratio of reporting regular @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Albinism_type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C537863 @@@difficulty falling and staying asleep@@@ at night compared to those without antidiabetic medication use (N=5 366, P<0.05) or those on @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ monotherapy (N=5 625, P<0.05).

citations.NLM: Xue P, Wu J, Tang X, Tan X, Benedict C. Oral Antidiabetics and Sleep Among Type 2 Diabetes Patients: Data From the UK Biobank Front Endocrinol (Lausanne). 2021;12():763138. PMID: 34803924
citations.BibTeX: @article{34803924, title={Oral Antidiabetics and Sleep Among Type 2 Diabetes Patients: Data From the UK Biobank}, author={Xue P and Wu J and Tang X and Tan X and Benedict C}, journal={Front Endocrinol (Lausanne)}, volume={12}, pages={763138}}

results.title: Diabetes medications related to an increased risk of falls and fall-related morbidity in the elderly.
results.text_hl: Selection emphasis was placed on randomized studies evaluating @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes medications@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Albinism_type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C537863 @@@falls@@@. DATA SYNTHESIS: There is no direct link between @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Albinism_type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C537863 @@@falls@@@; however, an indirect association caused by @DISEASE_Nervous_System_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D009422 @@@neuropathy@@@ secondary to @DISEASE_Vitamin_B_12_Deficiency @DISEASE_MESH:D014806 @@@vitamin B(12) deficiency@@@ may be of concern.

citations.NLM: Berlie HD, Garwood CL. Diabetes medications related to an increased risk of falls and fall-related morbidity in the elderly. Ann Pharmacother. 2010 Apr;44(4):712-7. PMID: 20215495
citations.BibTeX: @article{20215495, title={Diabetes medications related to an increased risk of falls and fall-related morbidity in the elderly.}, author={Berlie HD and Garwood CL}, journal={Ann Pharmacother}, volume={44}, number={4}, pages={712-7}}

results.title: The use of metformin, insulin, sulphonylureas, and thiazolidinediones and the risk of fracture: Systematic review and meta-analysis of observational studies.
results.text_hl: The use of @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Sulfonylurea_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013453 @@@sulphonylureas@@@ may increase @DISEASE_Fractures_Bone @DISEASE_MESH:D050723 @@@fracture@@@ risk; this risk is most likely attributed to an increased risk of hypoglycaemia-induced @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Albinism_type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C537863 @@@falls@@@. Further confirmation by additional RCTs is required to determine whether the observed association between the use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@, or @CHEMICAL_Sulfonylurea_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013453 @@@sulphonylureas@@@ and the risk of @DISEASE_Fractures_Bone @DISEASE_MESH:D050723 @@@fracture@@@ is due to treatment with these medications or confounding factors.

citations.NLM: Hidayat K, Du X, Wu MJ, Shi BM. The use of metformin, insulin, sulphonylureas, and thiazolidinediones and the risk of fracture: Systematic review and meta-analysis of observational studies. Obes Rev. 2019 Oct;20(10):1494-1503. PMID: 31250977
citations.BibTeX: @article{31250977, title={The use of metformin, insulin, sulphonylureas, and thiazolidinediones and the risk of fracture: Systematic review and meta-analysis of observational studies.}, author={Hidayat K and Du X and Wu MJ and Shi BM}, journal={Obes Rev}, volume={20}, number={10}, pages={1494-1503}}

results.title: Type 2 Diabetes and Osteoporosis: A Guide to Optimal Management.
results.text_hl: Healthy diet and physical exercise are very important for the prevention and treatment of both entities. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Sulfonylurea_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013453 @@@sulfonylureas@@@, dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitors, and @GENE_GLP1R @GENE_2740 @@@glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor@@@ agonists should be preferred for the treatment of @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2D@@@ in these @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, whereas strict targets should be avoided for the fear of @DISEASE_Hypoglycemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@hypoglycemia@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Albinism_type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C537863 @@@falls@@@, and @DISEASE_Fractures_Bone @DISEASE_MESH:D050723 @@@fractures@@@.

citations.NLM: Paschou SA, Dede AD, Anagnostis PG, Vryonidou A, Morganstein D, Goulis DG. Type 2 Diabetes and Osteoporosis: A Guide to Optimal Management. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2017 Oct 1;102(10):3621-3634. PMID: 28938433
citations.BibTeX: @article{28938433, title={Type 2 Diabetes and Osteoporosis: A Guide to Optimal Management.}, author={Paschou SA and Dede AD and Anagnostis PG and Vryonidou A and Morganstein D and Goulis DG}, journal={J Clin Endocrinol Metab}, volume={102}, number={10}, pages={3621-3634}}
